question.text: In an experiment, one set of plants were exposed to 12 hr day and 12 hr night and the plants flowered. The other set with similar exposure to the day-night period but with a dark period interrupted by the flash of light did not produce the flower. Such a plant is referred to as

solution.text: Every plant requires a certain amount of light and darkness to grow and this aspect is known as photoperiodism. The plants which require only a short period of darkness to flower are known as long-day plants whereas the plants which require a short day length and the long period of darkness without any interruption by light are known as short-day plants. Day-neutral plants are those which flower in which spectrum of the amount of light it receives. The intermediate type of plants is one which does not require long periods of darkness or light to flower.
